result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:43 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Corey Allen Heinl in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Corey Allen Heinl.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and notes PH has not been held at this time.  Atty Schutte states they're waiting for blood results and believes it's about 10 months out, asking to set STC out to allow time for results. ADA Becker states blood results are out at least 10 months. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 8:47 AM. bph

Court will schedule another PTC to check status of attorney. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues.  Tina Sitz from JSC makes statements regarding testing.  Court orders DE to go to JSC before leaving building today. Adjourned at 9:41 AM. bph

Defendant may be released upon posting $500.

Defendant to post additional $250 no later than 7/19/22 at 4:30 PM.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center.
